A sequence of rational numbers aₙ is a Cauchy sequence if for every rational ε > 0 there exists an integer N ≥ 0 such that |aⱼ - aₖ| ≤ ε for all j, k ≥ N (source: Analysis I by Terence Tao)
A sequence of rational numbers aₙ is a Cauchy sequence if for every rational ε > 0 there exists an index after which any two elements are ε-close
Converting code points into characters
Converting numeric data into text
Converting characters into code points
Converting text into numeric data
An encryption algorithm (e.g. a rotation cipher)
An encrypted message
A combination of tactics
A positional number system in base ten
A positional number system in base sixteen
(Informal) A real number is a point on the number line
(Formal) A real number is a Cauchy sequence
A move; an attack; a type of attack
A move that achieves a desired outcome (e.g. a checkmate, a material advantage, or a desirable draw)
